specification.name: error
specification.summary: Returns an error for all records that get passed to the processor.
specification.description:
Any time a record is passed to this processor it returns an error,
which results in the record being sent to the DLQ if it's configured, or the pipeline stopping.

**Important:** Make sure to add a [condition](https://conduit.io/docs/processors/conditions)
to this processor, otherwise all records will trigger an error.
specification.author: Meroxa, Inc.

message.description:
Error message to be returned. This can be a Go [template](https://pkg.go.dev/text/template)
executed on each [`Record`](https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/conduitio/conduit-commons/opencdc#Record)
being processed.

sdk.schema.decode.key.enabled.description: Whether to decode the record key using its corresponding schema from the schema registry.

sdk.schema.decode.payload.enabled.description: Whether to decode the record payload using its corresponding schema from the schema registry.

sdk.schema.encode.key.enabled.description: Whether to encode the record key using its corresponding schema from the schema registry.

sdk.schema.encode.payload.enabled.description: Whether to encode the record payload using its corresponding schema from the schema registry.

examples.summary: Error record with custom error message
examples.description:
This example shows how to configure the error processor to
return a custom error message for a record using a Go template.

config.message: custom error message with data from record: {{.Metadata.foo}}

want.error: custom error message with data from record: bar
